item.title: Another Activision Division Has Voted To Unionize
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/another-activision-division-has-voted-to-unionize/1100-6530394/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Communications Workers of America announced on March 25 that user-research workers at Activision have voted to form a union that Microsoft is already willing to recognize.

Officially called Activision User Research Union-CWA, this is the first video-game-researcher union of its kind in the North American video game industry. A press release about the union's formation explains that it wants to fight for better wages and job security for those working in user research at the Call of Duty maker.

The massive number of layoffs the video game industry has seen over the past couple of years was also cited as a reason for the union's formation. Organizing Committee member Pat Dimaandal argues that "workers should not feel punished for pursuing a career that they love, and that’s why we’re organizing toward long-term, sustainable careers in this industry."

The CWA confirms that there are now over 2,000 unionized workers at Microsoft-owned studios after the formation of this union. Unionization efforts began at Activision several years ago in the wake of the Civil Rights lawsuit against Activision Blizzard. Raven Software was the first studio to unionize, and Microsoft had to agree to allow unionization efforts at its studios during the process of acquiring Activision Blizzard. That opened the door to unions like this one and others at Microsoft-owned companies like ZeniMax Online.

CWA recently announced the United Videogame Workers-CWA union at GDC 2025 for those not working at a company like Microsoft. UVW-CWA is an industry-wide union that any game developer can join, and the CWA has confirmed it has already gotten over 350 members since it was announced last week.

item.title: StarCraft Miniatures Game Is Coming In 2026, With Board Games To Follow
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/starcraft-miniatures-game-is-coming-in-2026-with-board-games-to-follow/1100-6530392/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It may not be a new StarCraft video game, but a tabletop miniatures game set in the StarCraft universe will release in 2026, Polish game publisher Archon Studio has announced. The game will let players command armies based on the three factions from developer Blizzard's iconic sci-fi RTS series--the Terran, Zerg, and Protoss.

Details on game mechanics are currently light, but the StarCraft miniatures game will involve "dynamic, tactical battles" that Archon says will stay true to the "essence" of the video games.

"The game will feature high-quality miniatures, rich gameplay mechanics, and deep faction customization, ensuring an experience that both StarCraft veterans and tabletop wargamers will love," Archon said.

In addition to the miniatures game, Archon additionally announced it is also working on multiple board games set in the StarCraft universe. Those will arrive in 2027.

"As huge fans of StarCraft, we've spent countless hours playing this game," said Jarek Ewertowski, CEO of Archon Studio in the announcement blog post. "In fact, the history of Archon Studio is closely linked to StarCraft. It's an honor to bring this universe to the tabletop as a miniatures game."

More information about the StarCraft miniatures game will be given during an Archon Studio livestream on April 3. A more detailed preview of the minis themselves (a few of which you can see above) and gameplay mechanics will be revealed later this year.

StarCraft is just the latest iconic video game series to get the minis treatment, joining the likes of Halo: Flashpoint and Fallout: Factions, both of which released in 2024.

Blizzard's sci-fi IP may be largely dormant these days (StarCraft 2: Legacy of the Void, the last major game release in the series, released a decade ago in 2015), but the heroes of StarCraft did recently cross over with Blizzard's card game Hearthstone.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds More Free-To-Play Freebies For Subscribers
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/xbox-game-pass-adds-more-free-to-play-freebies-for-subscribers/1100-6530387/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Xbox Game Pass owners have had access to special perks for select free-to-play games, including League of Legends, Genshin Impact, and Overwatch 2. Today, Xbox has announced that a few more F2P titles will be sweetening the pot with free in-game cosmetics, currency, and more for the Game Pass faithful.

Four games--Heroes Of The Storm, Naraka: Bladepoint, Smite 2, and The Finals--will now offer extra benefits on both console and PC to those who link their Xbox accounts to each game. The official Xbox Wire post also confirms that even more titles will be added to the perk list in April, with Call of Duty: Warzone, Enlisted, Asphalt Legends Unite, and War Thunder specifically named.

The extra benefits coming today to Xbox Game Pass subscribers on consoles and PC are as follows:

  • Heroes Of The Storm
    • Unlock 30 heroes by linking a Battle.Net account to the Xbox Game Pass account
  • Naraka: Bladepoint
    • Logging in with an Xbox account will unlock all heroes, special Xbox-themed headwear, and the Phoenix Princess pack.
  • Smite 2
    • Linking an Xbox account will unlock a Smite 2 Welcome Pack, which includes five playable Gods, a new skin for Hecate, an emote, and a title.
  • The Finals
    • Linking an Embark ID to the Xbox account will unlock the Stryker Grid Set--which includes an outfit, three weapon skins, a charm, and a 25 percent boost to Match XP--as well as 500 Multibucks.

Among the F2P perks already offered through Xbox Game Pass are instant unlocks for all 160+ champions in League Of Legends, the Wings of Fate’s Course Intertwined gift in Genshin Impact, and all agents unlocked--as well as day-one access to new agents--in Valorant.

Xbox Game Pass subscriptions include a library of dozens of games across Xbox and PC for as low as $11 a month. Recent additions to the service include 33 Immortals, Blizzard Arcade Collection, Mythwrecked: Ambrosia Island, and Octopath Traveler II, while Atomfall is slated to join the service when it launches on March 27.

item.title: Naughty Dog's Intergalactic Won't Be Released Until 2027 At The Soonest - Report
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/naughty-dogs-intergalactic-wont-be-released-until-2027-at-the-soonest-report/1100-6530386/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Much like the state of The Witcher 4, Naughty Dog’s recently announced Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet won't be released until 2027 at the soonest as well, apparently. Bloomberg reporter Jason Schreier took to ResetEra to say in addition to the next Witcher, Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet will be out in 2027 at the soonest.

In the thread, Schreier corrected a commenter about what he said during the Game Awards after "teasing" that both games would be released in 2026, saying that was inaccurate.

"I'm pretty sure I said they were both going to be very early teases," he said. "Neither of those games will be out next year."

If Intergalactic ends up straight to the PS6, Naughty Dog will have skipped the PS5 generation in terms of new games completely. So far, the studio has released ports, remasters, and remakes, including The Last of Us Part II, Uncharted: Legacy of Thieves Collection, The Last of Us Part I, and The Last of Us Part II Remastered. At the very least, it could likely end up a cross-gen game.

"Set thousands of years in the future, Intergalactic puts players into the role of Jordan A. Mun, a dangerous bounty hunter who ends up stranded on Sempiria - a distant planet whose communication with the outside universe went dark hundreds of years ago," the official synopsis reads. "Jordan will have to use all her skills and wits if she hopes to be the first person in over 600 years to leave its orbit."

Naughty Dog revealed Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet at The Game Awards in 2024. It features a fully loaded cast with Tati Gabrielle (Uncharted) as Jordan, Kumail Nanjiani (Eternals) as a man called Colin Graves, and Tony Dalton (Hawkeye), with The Last of Us alumni Ashley Scott and Troy Baker in unrevealed roles.
